87499.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"14s9k","text":"Transfer 50-200 mL overnight culture to an appropriate centrifuge tube","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"19jit","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fm4m5","text":"Note: The optimal volume to use depends on the culture density and plasmid copy number. The optimal cell mass (OD600 x mL culture) for the HiBind‱ DNA Maxi Column is 300-400. For example, if the OD600 of a culture is 4.0, the optimal culture volume should be 75-100 mL. If excess culture cell mass is used, alkaline lysis will be inefficient, the HiBind‱ membrane will be overloaded, and the performance of the system will be decreased. The increase in lysate viscosity will require vigorous mixing which may result in shearing of genomic DNA and contamination the plasmid DNA.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":145,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":353,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"emoji","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"5C80FD534D7D11EE86D60A58A9FEAC02","name":":registered:"}},"1":{"type":"emoji","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"5C80FD534D7D11EE86D60A58A9FEAC02","name":":registered:"}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"7l31g","text":"Centrifuge at 4,000g for 10 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"26j39","text":"Decant or aspirate and discard the culture media.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9og2a","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"75vvp","text":"Note: To ensure that all traces of the medium are removed, use a clean paper towel to blot excess liquid from the wall of the tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b6o0g","text":"Add 12 mL Solution I/RNase A. Vortex or pipet up and down to completely resuspend the cells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ar75u","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cn72m","text":"Note: RNase A must be added to Solution I before use.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"u7ja","text":"Transfer the cell suspension to a 50 mL centrifuge tubes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"85q0h","text":"Add 12 mL Solution II. Invert and rotate the tube 2-3 minutes on a IKA rocker 3D at 25 rpm to obtain a cleared lysate.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4145v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2df0p","text":"Note: Avoid vigorous mixing as this will shear chromosomal DNA and lower plasmid purity. Do not allow the lysis reaction to proceed more than 5 minutes. Store Solution II tightly capped when not in use to avoid acidification from CO2 in the air.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3couo","text":"Add 16 mL Solution III. Invert and rotate the tube 2-3 minutes on a IKA rocker 3D at 25 rpm until flocculent white precipitates form.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"clkk6","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bngut","text":"Note: It is vital that the solution is mixed thoroughly and immediately after the addition of Solution III to avoid localized precipitation.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dujbq","text":"Centrifuge at 4258g (max. g!) for 30 minutes at 4°C. Otherwise use a Ultracentrifuge at 15000g for 10 min (Original protocol) A compact white pellet will form. Promptly proceed to the next step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fiei8","text":"Insert a HiBind‱ DNA Maxi Column into a 50 mL Collection Tube (provided).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":15,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"emoji","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"6BEC73F84D7F11EE86D60A58A9FEAC02","name":":registered:"}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"cgtjv","text":"Centrifuge at 4,000g for 5 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c3ig3","text":"Optional Protocol for Column Equilibration:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4br9t","text":"Add 3 mL 3M NaOH to the HiBind® DNA Maxi Column.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b2bcv","text":"Let sit at room temperature for 4 minutes.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"75r2j","text":"Centrifuge at 4,000g for 3 minutes.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fpqnq","text":"Discard the filtrate and reuse the collection tube.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4tj6k","text":"Transfer 20 mL cleared supernatant from Step 8 by CAREFULLY pipetting it into the HiBind‱ DNA Maxi Column. Be careful not to disturb the pellet and that no cellular debris is transferred to the HiBind‱ DNA Maxi Column.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":88,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":200,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"emoji","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"A0FB52224D7F11EE86D60A58A9FEAC02","name":":registered:"}},"1":{"type":"emoji","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"A0FB52224D7F11EE86D60A58A9FEAC02","name":":registered:"}}}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"e457l","text":"Discard the filtrate and reuse the collection tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"l7ke","text":"Repeat Steps 10-12 until all of the cleared supernatant has been transferred to the HiBind‱ DNA Maxi Column.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":90,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"emoji","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"B1CADF0F4D7F11EE86D60A58A9FEAC02","name":":registered:"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"a1plb","text":"Add 10 mL HBC Buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cjm8h","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8q3em","text":"Note: HBC Buffer must be diluted with 100% isopropanol prior to use. Please see the instructions in the “Preparing Reagents” section on Page 6.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"eigu2","text":"Centrifuge at 4,000g for 5 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"e7ehj","text":"Discard the filtrate and reuse the collection tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"68a8t","text":"Add 15 mL DNA Wash Buffer.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ejb02","text":"Note: DNA Wash Buffer must be diluted with 100% ethanol prior to use.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"5el9i","text":"Centrifuge at 4,000g for 5 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"agjl0","text":"Discard the filtrate and reuse the collection tube.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"6o71t","text":"Repeat Steps 20-22 for a second DNA Wash Buffer wash step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bfp0l","text":"Centrifuge the empty HiBind‱ DNA Maxi Column at 4,000g for 10 minutes to dry the column matrix.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":27,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"69ctv","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eltf0","text":"Note: It is important to dry the HiBind‱ DNA Maxi Column matrix before elution. Residual ethanol may interfere with downstream applications.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":39,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"emoji","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"EC6476D84D7F11EE86D60A58A9FEAC02","name":":registered:"}},"1":{"type":"emoji","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"EC6476D84D7F11EE86D60A58A9FEAC02","name":":registered:"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"551m2","text":"Transfer the HiBind‱ DNA Maxi Column to a nuclease-free 50 mL centrifuge tube (not provided).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":19,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"emoji","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"F1DA71A74D7F11EE86D60A58A9FEAC02","name":":registered:"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ep0a4","text":"Add 1.5-3 mL Elution Buffer or sterile deionized water directly to the center of the column membrane.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3qjtv","text":"Let it sit at room temperature for 5 minutes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"246ad","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4eidg","text":"Note: This represents approximately 65-80% of bound DNA. An optional second elution will yield any residual DNA, though at a lower concentration. Alternatively, a second elution may be performed using the first eluate to maintain a high DNA concentration.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"ngp8","text":"Use the first eluat for a second elution step.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"14f9b","text":"Qubit Concentration determination as described in separate protocol.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"36j38","text":"Aliquot and store DNA at -20°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4lbo4","text":"Check Solution II and Solution III for precipitation before use. Redissolve any precipitates by warming to 37°C","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"faidj","text":"Optional: Heat Elution Buffer to 65°C if plasmid DNA is \u003e10 kb","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d7v0c","text":"All centrifugation steps should be carried out at room temperature unless otherwise noted.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"96faj","text":"place here the concentrations and the aliquotation of the samples","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":65}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"3887e","text":"place here the informations on the samples","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":0,"length":42}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fu8br","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"dd526","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7htrr","text":"Prepare DNA Wash Buffer, HBC Buffer, and Solution I:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1628e","text":"Add vial of RNase A to the bottle of Solution I provided and store at 2-8˚C.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"92l94","text":"Dilute DNA Wash Buffer with 100% ethanol as writen on the bottle and store at room temperature.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"it5e","text":"Dilute HBC Buffer with 100% isopropanol  as writen on the bottle and store at room temperature.","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fggio","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"b64sr","text":"Das Protokoll beschreibt die In-Kulturnahme von Bacterial stabs zur Anreicherung einzelner Klone und zur Produktion von ausreichend Bakterien zur Gewinnung der gewünschten Plasmide mittels Maxi Prep.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
guidelines:
{"blocks":[{"key":"6nc4s","text":"Addgene ships plasmids as transformed bacteria in stab culture format. A stab culture is a type of Luria Broth (LB) Agar media, similar to a standard LB Agar plate. Unlike an LB Agar plate, a stab culture is created by piercing the LB agar with the bacteria instead of spreading it on the surface. The bacteria in a stab culture grow from the puncture site to spread across the surface of the stab culture.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9d978","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9e8h4","text":"Short Term Storage ofBacterial Stab","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":35}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"a1535","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"15ilk","text":"Stab cultures should be stored at 4°C upon receipt. The bacteria in the stab is guaranteed to live for at least 2 weeks when stored at 4°C.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":24,"length":13}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6u5mh","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cbkrn","text":"Long Term Storage - Isolating and Verifying the Plasmid and Creating a Glycerol Stock","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":85}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"cea2e","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"fah4p","text":"Within 2 weeks of receiving your new Addgene plasmid you should verify that the plasmid is correct and create a glycerol stock. Please follow Addgene’s recommended protocols below.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":7,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6822e","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"deks8","text":"1.       Streak Bacteria for Single Colonies - use your bacterial stab to streak bacteria onto a plate, grow overnight, and isolate single colonies.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":9,"length":35}],"data":{}},{"key":"n8on","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5uipd","text":"2.       Select an isolated, single colony to inoculate an overnight culture. Using a liquid culture will allow you to grow enough
bacteria for plasmid DNA purification and for creating glycerol stocks.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":46,"length":30},{"key":2,"offset":177,"length":24}],"data":{}},{"key":"29l4","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"h7hs","text":"1.       Addgene recommends selecting and inoculating 2-4 separate colonies for plasmid screening and verification.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ejcu3","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"826u2","text":"3.       Isolate your Plasmid DNA - many companies sell miniprep or maxiprep kits for easy plasmid isolation. Addgene also provides a protocol for plasmid purification without a kit.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":3,"offset":9,"length":24}],"data":{}},{"key":"7dqc2","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5qri1","text":"4.       After isolating plasmid DNA, Addgene recommends verifying the plasmid by diagnostic digest or sequencing before beginning any experiments.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"42df0","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3a9lm","text":"1.       Perform a Diagnostic Digest - verify backbone and insert sizes","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":4,"offset":9,"length":27}],"data":{}},{"key":"5358b","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"270ig","text":"2.       Sequence your Plasmid - verify key regions of the plasmid using DNA sequencing and compare these to sequences Addgene obtained from the plasmid, found on the plasmid page under “Sequences”","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":5,"offset":9,"length":21}],"data":{}},{"key":"b3nut","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6bg6t","text":"3.       After screening 2-4 colonies, if you find that your plasmid DNA is not correct, please view the instructions on how to report a problem with a plasmid.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":6,"offset":128,"length":31}],"data":{}},{"key":"2lqqr","text":"
","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bjca1","text":"5.       Once you have verified that the plasmid DNA is correct, keep the glycerol stocks corresponding to the colony that was
verified- most plasmids are stable for years when stored as bacterial glycerol stocks.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"51E77EFC4E2411EEAD330A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.addgene.org/protocols/streak-plate"}},"1":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"51E77EFC4E2411EEAD330A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.addgene.org/protocols/inoculate-bacterial-culture"}},"2":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"51E77EFC4E2411EEAD330A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.addgene.org/protocols/create-glycerol-stock"}},"3":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"51E77EFC4E2411EEAD330A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.addgene.org/protocols/purify-plasmid-dna"}},"4":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"51E77EFC4E2411EEAD330A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.addgene.org/protocols/diagnostic-digest"}},"5":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"51E77EFC4E2411EEAD330A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://www.addgene.org/protocols/sequence-analysis"}},"6":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"51E77EFC4E2411EEAD330A58A9FEAC02","url":"https://help.addgene.org/hc/en-us/articles/205433649-There-is-a-problem-with-the-plasmid-I-received-"}}}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"bh8ui","text":"Ampicillin:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"bg1nl","text":"100 mg/ml in sterilem H2O lösen; sterilfiltrieren, aliq.; - 20 °C","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"b4iq5","text":"1:1000 zu dem Platten bzw. Medium =\u003e 100 µg/ml","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"192ij","text":"Agarplatten gießen:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"64goi","text":"10 cm Greiner-Schalen","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"foh3m","text":"1,5 g Agar auf 100 ml LB-Broth-Medium o. 3,5 g LB Agar auf 100 ml ddH2O","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"crl1a","text":"aufkochen, abkühlen auf 50 °C im Wasserbad","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1c5ur","text":"unter der Bench + AB; gießen (3-4 mm hoch)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"eav9e","text":"reicht für ca. 4-5 Platten ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"50n02","text":"gegossene Platten im Kühlschrank in Plastiktüte über Kopf lagern","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fqe62","text":"Bacterial stab mit steriler Pipettespitze auf den Agarplatten ausstreichen; trocknen lassen","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"ectt9","text":"mit einer sterilen Pipettenspitze Klone picken und im 15 ml Falcontube in ca.   Medium/ mit AB einbringen","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":78,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"2","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4k759","text":"bei  im Schüttelinkubator für einige Stunden anziehen (Deckel leicht geöffnet)","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":3,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"78ar5","text":"restliche Platte mit Parafilm abdichten; als Backup im Kühlschrank in Plastiktüte über Kopf lagern","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"c0enr","text":"  auf  Medium/ mit AB in 250 ml Erlenmeyerkolben mit leicht geöffneter Alufolie als Deckel;   bei   im Wasserbad schütteln\n","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1},{"key":1,"offset":6,"length":1},{"key":2,"offset":92,"length":1},{"key":3,"offset":98,"length":1}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"250","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":1}},"1":{"type":"amount","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"amount":"100","error":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"unit":2}},"2":{"type":"duration","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"duration":0,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","pause":null,"preset":["overnight"],"start":null}},"3":{"type":"temperature","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"error_temperature":false,"guid":"","id":0,"label":"","scientificNotation":false,"temperature":"37","unit":10}}}}
